name: sk

options.description: print this help menu
print out the current version of skim
reverse the order of search result
Do not sort the result
specify the fields to be matched
specify the fields to be transformed
use regex instead of fuzzy match
Fuzzy matching algorithm: [skim_v1|skim_v2|clangd] (default: skim_v2)
case sensitive or not
comma seperated keybindings, in KEY:ACTION such as 'ctrl-j:accept,ctrl-k:kill-line'
Enable Multiple Selection
Disable Multiple Selection
Disable mouse events
command to invoke dynamically
Start skim in interactive(command) mode
change color theme
Disable horizontal scroll
Keep the right end of the line visible on overflow
Line starts with the start of matched pattern
Do not clear previous items if command returns empty result
Send command error message if command fails

Height of skim's window (--height 40%)
Disable height feature
Minimum height when --height is given by percent (default: 10)
Screen Margin (TRBL / TB,RL / T,RL,B / T,R,B,L) e.g. (sk --margin 1,10%)

prompt string for command mode
parse ANSI color codes for input strings
Number of spaces for a tab character (default: 8)

History file
Maximum number of query history entries (default: 1000)

Maximum number of command history entries (default: 1000)
command to preview current highlighted line ({}) We can specify the fields. e.g. ({1}, {..3}, {0..})
specify the initial query
specify the initial query for interactive mode
comma seperated keys that can be used to complete skim
Read input delimited by ASCII NUL(\0) characters
Print output delimited by ASCII NUL(\0) characters
Do not clear screen on exit
Print query as the first line
Print command query as the first line (after --print-query)
Print matching score in filter output (with --filter)

--literal
--hscroll-off=COL
--jump-labels=CHARS
--no-bold
--pointer
--phony

tldr:
> Fuzzy finder written in Rust.
> Similar to `fzf`.
> More information: <https://github.com/lotabout/skim>.

- Start skim on all files in the specified directory:

`find {{path/to/directory}} -type f | sk`

- Start skim for running processes:

`ps aux | sk`

- Start skim with a specified query:

`sk --query "{{query}}"`

- Select multiple files with `Shift + Tab` and write to a file:

`find {{path/to/directory}} -type f | sk --multi > {{filename}}`
